title: "Cannot load Android system" trying to solve with "Apply update from ADB", can't perform instruction
content:
My battery died, when I plugged my phone and turned it on I got "Cannot load Android system" with two options:
Try again
Factory data reset

I saw in this thread https://support.google.com/pixelphone/thread/17930356?hl=en&fbclid=IwAR328LdN-m8S9QdoBMteWCeD8zq7ExnjIFqWr7SvGh1z0hkyXlFF05WjSfA
That someone with pixel2 managed to solve it without Factory data reset by following the instructions product expert John provided for "Apply update from ADB".

I don't have usb debugging enabled so I had to follow his instructions for getting into recovery mode without usb debugging.
I'm able to get to the bootloader, and I have recovery mode option, but pressing it gets me to the recovery mode I got before which only has the 2 above options. 
I don't the "No command" page as he mentions I'm supposed to. Therefore I don't have the ability to get to the sideload menu and continue to update from ADB.

Would much appreciate any help.

Thanks, Dotan
